nodes.description:
"Agamemnon is the leader of the Achaean forces and takes Chryseis as his prize."
"Agamemnon is a character who consults a prophet and demands compensation from Achilles."
"Agamemnon is a character who reconciles with Achilles."

"Achilles is a proud warrior who is concerned for his comrades and agrees to a plan to allow Patroclus to take his place in battle."
"Achilles is a character who receives a new suit of armor from Thetis and rides out to battle at the head of the Achaean army."
"Achilles is a character who experiences grief and rage, and is persuaded to rejoin the battle."
"Achilles is a character who fights the god of the river Xanthus and kills Hector in a dramatic duel."
"Achilles is a character who drags Hector's body in circles around Patroclus's funeral bier."
"Achilles is a character who refuses to fight in the war and seeks revenge against the Achaeans."
"Achilles is the Achaeans' greatest warrior and claims Briseis."
"Chryseis is a maiden captured by the Achaeans and taken as Agamemnon's prize."

"Briseis is a character who is demanded as compensation by Agamemnon."
"Briseis is a maiden captured by the Achaeans and claimed by Achilles."

"Chryses is a character who prays to Apollo and causes a plague upon the Achaean camp."
"Chryses is Chryseis's father and a priest of the god Apollo."

"Apollo is the god worshipped by Chryses and sends a plague upon the Achaean camp."
"Apollo is a god who knocks Patroclus' armor to the ground, causing the counterattack to falter."

"Thetis is a sea-nymph who enlists the services of Zeus."
"Thetis is a character who persuades Hephaestus to forge a new suit of armor for Achilles."
"Thetis is a sea-nymph and mother of Achilles who enlists the services of Zeus."
"Thetis is a character who goes to Mount Olympus and persuades Hephaestus to forge Achilles a new suit of armor."

"Zeus is the king of the gods and is enlisted by Thetis to seek revenge against the Achaeans."
"Zeus is the king of the gods and is enlisted by Thetis."
"Calchas is a prophet who determines the cause of the plague."
"Trojan is a location associated with the war."

"The Trojans are a group of warriors who are in conflict with the Achaeans."
"The Trojans are the enemy of the Achaeans and have set fire to one of their ships."
"The Trojans breach a cease-fire treaty with the Achaeans."

"The Achaeans are a group of warriors who are in conflict with the Trojans."
"The Achaeans suffer great losses due to the Trojans' breach of the treaty."
"The Achaeans are the army of Achilles and are stranded at Troy without their ships."
"Paris duels with Menelaus."

"Menelaus duels with Paris."
"Menelaus is a character who makes a courageous effort to bring Patroclus's body back to their camp."

"Hector duels with Ajax."
"Hector is a character who confronts Achilles outside the walls of Troy and is killed by him in a duel."
"Hector is a character who orders his men to camp outside the walls of Troy."
"Hector is a character whose body is dragged by Achilles in circles around Patroclus's funeral bier."
"Ajax duels with Hector."

"Diomedes is an Achaean warrior who goes on a reconnaissance mission with Odysseus."
"Diomedes is a great Achaean warrior whose heroism proves fruitless."
"Odysseus is an Achaean warrior who goes on a reconnaissance mission with Diomedes."
"The Achaean ramparts are a defensive structure that protects the Achaean ships."
"The Achaean ships are the means of transportation for the Achaean warriors."

"Patroclus is a character who is killed by Hector."
"Patroclus is a fine warrior and friend of Achilles who takes his place in battle."
"Patroclus is a character whose funeral is celebrated with athletic games."
"Nestor proposes a plan to allow Patroclus to take Achilles' place in battle."

"Hephaestus is a god who forges Achilles a new suit of armor."
"Hephaestus is a god who forges a new suit of armor for Achilles."
"The Trojan army is a group of soldiers who flee in terror back behind the city walls."

"Xanthus is a river that is angered by Achilles' actions."
"Xanthus is a river and a god who is angered by Achilles' actions."

"Troy is a city that Hector refuses to flee inside of."
"Troy is a location associated with King Priam."
"Athena is a goddess who tricks Hector into turning around and fighting Achilles."
"King Priam is a character who pleads with Achilles to return Hector's body."
"Achaean camp is a location associated with Achilles and the Achaeans."
